duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform complex and specialized tasks involved with the diagnostic imaging and treatment of patients and operation of nuclear medicine related equipment as directed by the physician.
Demonstrate continued competence in treating and caring for individuals based upon age-specific needs utilizing a developmental perspective.
Responsible for the achievement of patient outcomes through implementation of critical pathways and in accordance with the mission, vision, and values of the organization.

education_certification.credential: Completion of accredited coursework in nuclear medicine technology or graduate of an associate’s or bachelor’s degree program in nuclear medicine.

Current certification with the Nuclear Medicine Technology Certification Board (NMTCB) and/or American Registry of Radiologic Technologists, Nuclear Medicine Technologists (ARRT (N)) and state licensure required.
Computer proficiency and picture archiving and communication systems (PACS) experience.
Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required or dually certified in both AHA Advanced Cardiac Life Support and AHA Pediatric Advanced Life Support.
